intro: Cerinthe suevica, commonly known as the Suevic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Cerinthe suevica is a perennial herb that is relatively rare and can be found in specific alpine habitats.
